normalized: the next afternoon, 13:30.
the prime minister's residence.
in there, the figures of asagi and yamamoto, the director of public safety 3rd division, could be seen.
the pair had come to tokyo, invited by prime minister asai koujirou.
they passed through to his office, guided by prime ministerial aides.

name: asai
normalized: yo, yamamoto-kun.
i'm glad you came.
prime minister asai, with a welcoming face, and
chief cabinet secretary nonomura, with his habitual grumpy face, were waiting for the two in the office.

name: yamamoto
normalized: we haven't talked in a while.
prime minister, chief cabinet secretary.
yamamoto bowed his head in courtesy.
asagi, who kept behind yamamoto, also bowed in silence.

name: nonomura
normalized: if you're commanding the taimanin, it seems telecommunication would be easier than speaking face-to-face.
even i rarely meet with you.
right, yamamoto-kun?
nonomura, who was always critical of the taimanin in one way or another, immediately made a snide comment.

name: yamamoto
normalized: i apologize.
i'm sorry to always take up the chief cabinet secretary's time.
yamamoto brazenly made an apology, and nonomura snorted a little with a face like he'd eaten a bug.
without caring at all about such an exchange, asai began talking to yamamoto.

name: asai
normalized: yamamoto-kun.
she's the reported female commanding officer of the taimanin, right?

name: yamamoto
normalized: excuse me for delaying this greeting.
this is igawa asagi.

name: asagi
normalized: my name is igawa asagi.
introduced by yamamoto, asagi bowed to asai.

name: asai
normalized: i've often heard reports from yamamoto-kun.
nice to meet you.
i am asai koujirou.
asai gently held his right hand out to asagi.

name: asagi
normalized: pleased to meet you.
that gesture, which was politician-like and unusually refined, was not what asagi preferred, but she exchanged handshakes with asai perfectly courteously, as the commander of the taimanin.

name: asai
normalized: this is sudden, but, of course, we did ask you to come.
well, do sit down.
asai suggested the sofa to asagi and yamamoto, sat down himself, and exchanged looks with those in his surroundings.
the aides and secretaries who had remained in the room left.
it was as expected.
it was highly unlikely that asagi, the commanding officer of a task force, would be summoned to the official residence just to meet her.
asai started to explain about a 『special mission』 he had for the pair.
it was related to yamazaki, whom asagi and the others had killed in tokyo kingdom a few days previously.
he had engaged in various illegal activities at an important post in the ruling party.
the public funds that yamazaki had been able to put in his pocket totalled more than 10 billion yen.
it had been established that part of that, 3 billion yen's worth of cash and securities, was in a secret second residence that he had been hiding in while he was on the run.
the 『special mission』 was that they wanted them to recover those secret funds from his estate.
asagi, who listened to the story that far, turned it over in her mind.
to put it bluntly, she didn't know what the significance of the 『special mission』 was.
why ask a taimanin for such a thing?
yamamoto probably thought the same way as well, and he gently reported to asai without changing his expression.

name: yamamoto
normalized: with all due respect, prime minister, wouldn't it be more suitable to leave that kind of task to the police?

name: nonomura
normalized: we know that even if you don't say it.
please be quiet and listen.
nonomura said, seeming irritated.
it looked like, rather than being displeased that yamamoto had talked back to asai, he harboured displeasure towards getting the taimanin to do the 『special mission』 in and of itself.
at any rate, it was a normal reaction for nonomura, who wanted to reduce the power of the taimanin, but――

name: asai
normalized: certainly, it's as you say.
however, there are two reasons i expressly wanted to ask you.

name: yamamoto
normalized: let's hear them.
yamamoto urged, and asai made a slightly stern-looking face.

name: asai
normalized: first of all, it appears that ten guards, apparently juujin (beastmen), are readily protecting the secondary residence even now.

name: asagi
normalized: juujin?

name: yamamoto
normalized: is that certain?
asai nodded.

name: asai
normalized: this is a picture, taken super-telephoto.
please look.
asai produced a photograph from a file marked 『top secret』.
the target's secondary residence and bodyguards were depicted.
seeming to have been taken from a considerable distance, and moreover at night, the picture was blurry, but the head of one of the bodyguards was densely covered in fur.
was it a bear juujin or something?
certainly, it was unlikely to be a normal human.

name: yamamoto
normalized: that is a juujin.
yamamoto said, calmly.

name: asai
normalized: so it seems.
so, impounding by the police would be extremely difficult.
it's like saying “go die”.

name: yamamoto
normalized: what's the other reason?

name: asai
normalized: that is…
asai suddenly hesitated to speak.
like it was quite difficult to say.
as asagi was thinking so, nonomura interjected without delay.

name: nonomura
normalized: prime minister, is this all right?
how about not relying on the likes of taimanin and thinking of yet another method?

name: asai
normalized: no, nonomura-sensei, i called them for that reason.
seeming very uneasy about saying it due to having been warned against it by nonomura, asai opened his heavy mouth.

name: asai
normalized: the truth is, together with the secret funds, we want you to procure a certain secret document.

name: yamamoto
normalized: secret document, you say?

name: asai
normalized: i can tell you it's a very dangerous document that would shock the political and financial worlds.
it tells of how he was able to store away private funds said total 10 billion yen.

name: asai
normalized: consequently, i wanted not the police, but you to proceed in absolute secrecy.
asai ordered the recovery of those secret documents in the vague manner of speaking truly characteristic of a politician.

name: yamamoto
normalized: in short, you're saying there's a need to maintain secrecy?

name: asai
normalized: that's right.
because the documents amount to special a-class top secret documents, the ones to be assigned to the mission will be few, one person if possible, and should be people we can trust.
asai closed his mouth, with an expression that said he assumed they understood the rest without him even saying it.

name: yamamoto
normalized: you're saying you want to leave it to asagi alone?
yamamoto confirmed, and asai nodded in silence.

name: nonomura
normalized: prime minister.
i am still opposed.
the dangers in entrusting the yamazaki matter to the taimanin are too great.
these people are “outsiders”, after all.

name: nonomura
normalized: even if they are juujin, there are any number of ways to deal with them without using the likes of taimanin, such as the police's anti-demon special forces.
prime minister, please reconsider.

name: asai
normalized: nonomura-sensei.
i have faith in yamamoto-kun, and the organization he leads.
yamamoto-kun.
you can do this, right?
asai flatly rejected nonomura's advice, and urged yamamoto so.

name: asagi
normalized: （i'm grateful that he has faith in us, but…）
upon leaving the office, asagi had the first word.

name: asagi
normalized: you took that up pretty easily, didn't you?

name: yamamoto
normalized: are you displeased?

name: asagi
normalized: i don't have a very good feeling about being a convenient pawn for the prime minister.
there was no need to keep up appearances anymore.
asagi spoke with a plainly unhappy face.

name: yamamoto
normalized: hmm.
it's about the incident from a few days ago, and yet…

name: asagi
normalized: changing the subject all of a sudden, eh?
yamamoto continued talking, without moving an eyebrow at asagi's retort.

name: yamamoto
normalized: while investigating the details of how furst, who disguised himself as muroi, infiltrated the village, we established that there was no reason to doubt him at all.

name: asagi
normalized: looks like it.
the procedures were all green.
basically, it means he infiltrated us by legal means.

name: yamamoto
normalized: that's right.
in other words, it's certain that there was guidance from someone on the inside.
without hesitation or delay, yamamoto said something that could not be overlooked.

name: asagi
normalized: within the taimanin…?

name: yamamoto
normalized: there are people inside the ruling party who are linked to nomad.

name: asagi
normalized: …what a nice conversation.
asagi cracked a joke, but she still felt a chill.

name: yamamoto
normalized: furthermore, one suspicion comes to mind regarding the missions we have accomplished.

name: asagi
normalized: suspicion?

name: yamamoto
normalized: no matter how things got this way, there is a high probability that they have been devised so that nomad profits from the result.
asagi chewed over yamamoto's words for a little while.

name: asagi
normalized: certainly, ryuumon, the chinese crime syndicate that opposes nomad, has been pushed away over this year, and the picture of the influence of darkness in japan is being practically repainted with nomad.

name: asagi
normalized: ――so, how are that and taking up this mission related?

name: yamamoto
normalized: if we assume that there is a traitor at the centre of the ruling party, it will amount to something rife with political elements.
in that case, it's a world where things do not proceed just based on reason and concrete evidence.

name: asagi
normalized: got it.
the aforementioned “secret documents” are the aim, right?
yamamoto nodded.
his face was tinged with dread.

name: yamamoto
normalized: influencing politics is a weapon in itself.
if the existence of the prime minister's so-called special a-class documents is genuine, they will probably amount to a beneficial asset for us too.

name: asagi
normalized: does that mean we should keep the contents of the special a-class documents on record too?
childishness mixed into asagi's voice.
yamamoto also smiled, unusually.

name: yamamoto
normalized: that is a scandalous expression.
just suppose we create a few backups, in case.

name: asagi
normalized: understood.
she grinned.

name: yamamoto
normalized: however…
yamamoto started to say something.
the next moment――
goonn!

name: yamamoto
normalized: wha?!
a roaring sound.
the official residence shook greatly.
it was an explosion.

name: yamamoto
normalized: asagi?!

name: asagi
normalized: it's from the entrance!
the guards inside the official residence moved, becoming hectic.
the source of the explosion was directly opposite them.
however――

name: asagi
normalized: in this case.
subsequently, an uproar from the office.

name: yamamoto
normalized: the explosion was a diversion.

name: asagi
normalized: yeah!
even before he said so, the pair were returning to the office.
today, when the two came to the official residence.
an “accident”, with this timing.
was it a coincidence?
or――
